Reviews.Title: “Dont give this people your credit card!”
Reviews.Author: Aura K
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room in parador villas de sotomoyor, called to cancel more than 24hrs prior to the reserved date, and they simply charged our credit card half the price of the reserved room, without authorization, because as they say "its their cancelation policy". They never refunded our money. Had to go through the hassle of calling the credit card company to make the claim. Avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “Parador Villas Sotomayor charges credit card without authorization”
Reviews.Author: Eva G
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation for this "parador", called prior to 24hrs to cancel the resercation and I fund out that they had charged my credit card half the amount that it cost to stay! And... they would not by any means return my money. I had to spend an entire day, calling this people, and each time I called they let me waiting until just I had to hang up. Finally I called my credit card to make the claim. Do not give this people your credit card, they will charge your card and laught and not give you back your money.

Reviews.Title: “It was excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: SpicyindygirL
Reviews.Content: People so kind, polite, i was a lil scared about the reviews in here but i stayed at night and there was not bug bothering outside, the weather was really nice... Coldddd if you want to scape from the hot weather and the same routine u should go there... Me and my friend love it!

Reviews.Title: “Is a Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Lisy217
Reviews.Content: If you want to spend a relax and great weekend you have to come here, here you forgot the traffic, stress, noises, buildings of the city, in Villas Sotomayor you found peace, relaxing, nature, fresh air, kind people, is really great. Me and my family stay there for three days and two nights, we spend an awesome time, the villas are comfortable, have everything you need, microwave, queen beds, air conditioning and the best of all have hammocks where you get rest and see the beautiful landscape. i visit a new Parador every year, this Parador I think has many attractions than any other, have horseback riding, kayacs, gym, bicycles, rappeling, and also you can camping there is wonderful. Overall we enjoy it, me, my couple and my kids will come back soon. Thanks to all the personal of Parador Villas Sotomayor all of you are helpful, kind, friendly i see you soon

Reviews.Title: “Unspectable”
Reviews.Author: betrade
Reviews.Content: I went to this place thinking it was nice place to stay with my family like I saw the previous in the inter net they look so nice like a paradise,but when I,got there ask the reception to show me around it was terrible strange people around no securiity no gates up there in those woods things ain't to good on these days the first thing I,saw the swimming pool small and not to much agradable on first sight,the rooms so small and horable everything wasn't compatible with the price it was to cold in the afternoon not considerable for children's health,suddenly a mosquito bit me so hard not like usually and normal ones that's when I convinced after all to leave.And headed to Ponce Hilton 100%times better than that horable mistery unlikely place don't go I'm 100% sure you will leave like it happened to me thanks to JehovÃ¡ God,that they don't ask for deposit if not I would sertenly loose my money ,don't no wy people trick others with these promotions the reception told me the owner was a membership and president of hotels in P.R that's wy It's category has 5 stars wich should've been 0 or1 see for your self if you think I'm not saying the truth,waist of time and money.

Reviews.Title: “A rejuvenating experience!”
Reviews.Author: ItoandNaidy
Reviews.Content: During our stay we enjoyed memorable and unforgettable experiences. Escaping the hustle and bustle of the big city of Chicago, we became one with nature. Experiencing the beauty and siren environment that this beautiful island and its culture have to offer. We found the villas to be cozy, clean and intimate, giving a sense of serenity. The staff was outstanding! Making us feel like part of the family being very hospitable and accommodating to our needs. The authentic Puerto Rican foods, tropical cocktails and a nice selection of quality Puerto Rican cigars, were excellent. Creating a pleasurable ambiance. Adjuntas natural beauty of the mountains is breathtaking. Itâ€™s a place for those seeking to rejuvenate mind, body and soul. We plan and look forward to making this a yearly getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Disappointed188
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel during a recent family stay. While surroundings were well landscaped and the scenery was beautiful, the villas were poorly kept. Old and tasteless linen and comforters, bathroom in dire need of updating, roaches and other insects in rooms....I could go on. Review would have gotten only one star but staff was very friendly and did try to make my stay more pleasureable. Hard to do with such poor housing. Definately not worth the high prices they charge!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: nikyseahorse
Reviews.Content: I must share our great experience with everyone, because some people don't appreciate what a nice time you can have while staying at Villas de Sotomayor: relaxing on a hammock, enjoying delicious food from the hotel restaurant, discovering the beauty of nature (for example: horseback riding, kayaking, hiking in the Guilarte forest, visiting the animal farm), or just sleeping in on a cold morning with the one you love....I find these small moments in life to be very gratiying when your daily routine is full of fast pace living and no attention to the small pleasures that a weekend getaway can offer. I was impressed by how wrong the prior negative feedback was since I found the hotel to be very clean, customer service and hospitality was excellent, food was great, and the hotel surroundings were beautiful. I guess you actually have to take the time to enjoy these things so that you can actually appreciate them so maybe others before me have only focused on small inconveniences when rating their stay. So, pay no attention to vicious feedback that disregards all that Villas de Sotomayor can represent for a people seeking a great time which is what I did and I was pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “I was scare, because TripAvisor reviewers”
Reviews.Author: Tropcalaser
Reviews.Content: People who likes nightlife, the best option is San Juan, but if you want just keep in touch with nature, do some horse riding, kayaling and visit the lake. This is a great opportunitty. The food and wine selection is good and Adjuntas people are so kind. I visited also Hacienda Monte Alto and saw the process to develop excellent cofee from the mountains. One advise ask the local for locations and what to see, they will help you with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “A unique, authentic Puerto Rican experience”
Reviews.Author: Adventurous_Mamacita
Reviews.Content: It seems like almost everyone who has reviewed this parador either loved it or hated it. I can say that we enjoyed it and I will never forget the experience. The villas have definitely been updated/renovated since some of the reviewers posted their comments. We were pleasantly surprised by how up-to-date the appliances and furniture were in our room. This is a place to go for an authentic Puerto Rican experience, not a 5-star one. We were the only non-Puerto Ricans there when we stayed, and we found that a plus overall. However, since we were traveling with a 2-year-old, the booming music late at night from nearby villas was not a highlight! Fortunately, our daughter was able to sleep without really hearing it and the partyers next door decided to take their celebration elsewhere. . . Also, the food at the restaurant is nothing special, so we only ate there once. Pluses -- great staff who were extremely helpful, wireless internet access, BEAUTIFUL mountain scenery, nice pools for big and little people, farm animals to see, etc. We did have a horrible problem with ants in our villa, which really sort of ruined the experience for us, in the end. We couldn't leave ANY kind of food whatsoever on the kitchen counter or dining table without an armyt of ants coming for it within several minutes. So I'd characterize the rooms as glorified cabins more than anything else, and if you have that mentality, you'll be fine. The Adjuntas area is breathtakingly beautiful, but be warned that it takes a LONG time to get almost anywhere (except for Ponce and central Adjuntas) from the parador due to winding roads along cliffs where you have to drive about 20 miles per hour (while the locals whiz past you at frightening speeds). The Camuy Caves, for instance, are probably close to 1.5 hours away because of this--even though you might look at a map (or talk to a local) and think it's just 45 minutes away. Having said all of that, I'm SO glad that we got away from San Juan for a few days to experience this side of Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “This review is about the horse Ride. Please read this before you get on a horse ride”
Reviews.Author: tlaws1
Reviews.Content: The website for this Place is http://www.paradorvillassotomayor.com/ This is a letter I wrote to the manager after coming back from the horse ride. Please read: VERY IMPORTANT: Dear Manager, The reason for this email is to express a concern and let you know about a complaint I have after using your facility. We did not stay in the apartments but I did go to ride the horses. My concern is that after riding the horse in the trail we went in (30minutes) I am glad I made the decision not to allow my 6 year old child ,who has never had experience on a horse, ride on one of yours in that trail. The terrain was fit for only grown ups or children that have had some experience with horses before. The horses were tired and disobedient at times. We ask the leader when was the last time they got fed and he said 9am in the morning and it was already past 5pm. The horses were stopping every chance they got to eat. The trail was rough. This is fun for someone that knows what they are doing with a horse, it would have been tragic for my 6 year old child. Especially when the horses go up the hill and need to gather up speed. I had to hold on really tight or else I would have fell. My proposal to this is to warn people before they make a decision to ride the horses and give the people some kind of training as far as what to say and how to turn the horse since after you pay, no matter if you change your mind, you do not get a refund. Which brings me to my complaint. I paid for my 12 year old daughter to ride a horse thinking it would be fine since she is my height and a lot more coordinated than my 6 year old. Well instead of tying all the horses up and allowing every one to climb on, they unleashed every horse as people were getting on. This caused the first person to try to control the horse until everyone got on. My daughter got on last and the horse was turned around the wrong way. Not only that it was walking the opposite way our and the leader's horse was turning frightening my daughter. I was trying to tell her how to turn and in the meantime my father tried to help her and my horse stepped on him in the process. I told the leader over and over to just let her down she was afraid, but instead the leader proceeded to say "I will hold the leash of her horse so she will feel better". I decided she was too scared so again I told them again to please get her off the horse. Finally they got her off and I was happy she did because as beautiful as it was for me (the trail) it would have been terrifying for her and anyone who never had experience on a horse. I never got my money back even though she never rode. This policy is wrong and people should be pre-warn before being charged for the ride. In the near future I could see a lot of lawsuits being filled against Villa Sotomayor if the policies and procedures do not change. I would not like for this to happen and will not like anyone ridding a horse being hurt so I would pray that you would consider my suggestions. Thanks for your time. Sincerely, Attachments:

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: BlondieK97
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on a Paradores flyer I received from a travel agent. The hotel did not live up to the flyer one bit. The area it is in is absolutely spectacular, however there is little to do. There are almost no restaurants, no hiking trails or anything else. The room was horrible & uncomfortable. We "upgraded" , however it was no upgrade. The rooms were small. We had no hot water, a tiny TV with a few Spanish speaking channels & even less English speaking ones. We tried to sleep their one night & quickly checked out the next day & found another hotel in Ponce. I'm writing this review a couple years later after just having a fabulous trip to Puerto Rico (unlike this one). The only thing this hotel might be good for are large families or reunions, absolutely horrible for 2 people. If you're staying in Puerto Rico, I recommend staying in the San Juan area, & then going to other areas of the island during the day. Even in Ponce we had a very hard time finding nice restaurants to eat at.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!!!!!!!! The worst experiencei ever had in a Parador...”
Reviews.Author: DidyPuertoRico
Reviews.Content: I went to villa sotomayor on my 2nd anniversary, what a mess...First of all, the room is so ugly, dirty, small, the toilet was damaged, the microwave too, if you get a hot bath, then yo dont have air conditioner, the floor was dirty, the bed had a hole in the middle, the bedÂ´s sheets were dirty and had burn marks from cigarettes, well a nightmare...the restaurant, ah the restaurant, the prices are very very high, the food is baaaaaad, if you asked for carne frita (fried pork) then you get grasa frita (fried fat), if you asked for french fries, then you get burn fries, very tiny portions of everything, the desserts were as small as my middle finger and for the end when i was doing my check out (finally), they want me to pay tips for the great service, jaja what do you think i do???? P.D. I had visited about 15 paradores in Puerto Rico and this is the one and only that i have not recommend, the others are sooo excellent...

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE VILLAS SOTOMAYOR=VERY RELAXING”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: VIILAS SOTOMAYOR is located in beautiful ADJUNTAS, PR. IT is not a fancy place, but the food and the people are truly wonderful. THE OWNER GOES OUT OF HIS WAY TO MAKE YOU FEEL AT HOME. THE SETTING is very country and there are @ 16 horses to ride around the @ 30 individual villas, each with a hammock in the balcony. Gorgeous "FLAMBOYAN" trees and beautiful flowers are everywhere. The rates are reasonable and it is very easy to reach from Ponce, PR, being just @ 15 mins. away through a new highway. When you want to get away and see a starlit night, and hear the coquies sing=="kokeee==kokeee" , this is the place to stay. A river runs next to it and a waterfall is nearby. Actually you can pick delicious fruits to eat from the trees in the area. Their tel. # is (787) 829-1717.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to Villas Sotomayor to have a relaxing weekend and to do a little tourism but we ended up having an awful time. This so called hotel doesnâ€™t have any villas. What they call villas are extremely small rooms with absolutely no space to move around and without windows to look at the beautiful mountain surroundings. They don't necessarily give you what they offer in the rooms, and the accesories that they do give you like the frige smell rotten and the water in the bathroom was brown!!! You have to go by car to the lobby or to the so called restaurant which is really just a few tables. They give a bad name to the word Parador, please think twice before staying there, there are better places in Puerto Rico to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “An Antidote To Underrated Overpriced Hotels? What a rip off!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Looking for a relaxing time in the rainforest on an eco friendly hotel/resort, the Sotomayor was the worst hotel that I have ever stayed in. More expensive than a room in a super cool boutique hotel, the VIP villa at Sotomayor is worst than a shack in a favella/shanty town. Nothing chic about this shack. I doubt it's even legal to hire out such a space. We tried to cancel three hours after making the reservation, after finding a bad review online, but there were no refunds on cancelations before five days of the check in date. First nights deposit was needed to book...in my case $210. Upon checking in we had to wear these pink wrist bands, (as if we were going to come circuit party or some all inclusive 18-30 cruise...I still don't know why)and given a TV remote controll with the room number painted on with nail polish ($20 fee if lost, like we came to watch tv.)No one showed us to our villa and we spent the next 15 minutes driving around in circles trying to look for it, until we went back to reception to ask again. Located by the side of a busy road with trucks passing by every five minutes with loud speakers advertising everything from men's fashions to political announcements, this was a great way to start our relaxing weekend, after a 4 hour drive from San Juan. Inside none of the covers were on the electrical outlets or light switches. The room was small, the TVs didn't work, cieling fans rattled as if they were going to fall off, there was a lizard living in the drain of the bath tub amongst half ripped anti slip flower stickers. When unfolding the sofa bed, we found a cap and a pair of dirty red panties, the sheets were still on and the cushions were stained with blood. It was like being in some horror film. We couldn't stop laughing. The hotel claims to be an eco friendly resort, but from my experience it couldn't be further from the truth. After taking pictures and going to reception to tell them what was going on, they moved us to another villa/room that was cleaner and offered us a free breakfast. After all the stress in the first room, it was pretty difficult to enjoy much else. They sold no bottled water or had any kind of internet access. I will never stay there again. If you're going you're going to stay in the area try La Casa Grande...accomodations are more simple, cleaner,cheaper, better restaurant, yoga,in a pristine rain forest, and eco friendly...pure magic if you want to get away.
